list-item.p: Nitrobenzene-induced neurodegenerative disease in rats with evidence of neurobehavioural deficits.
Nitrobenzene-mediate acetylcholinesterase activities in the brain regions of rats.
Exposure of nitrobenzene to rats caused oxidative stress in the brain of the rats.
Nitrobenzene-induced inflammation in midbrain, cerebrum and cerebellum of rats.
Vernonia amygdalina inhibited lipid peroxidation in the brain of neurodegenerative rats.
Neuroprotective mechanism of Vernonia amygdalina is via antioxidant, acetylcholinesterase suppression, lipid peroxidation inhibition, anti-inflammatory and neurobehavioural restoring abilities.
